commitResults.messageTitle: Rename Duke class files to SirDuke, add greet and exit functions.
commitResults.messageBody:
Renamed Duke in README to  SirDuke.

Renamed and personalised System.out.println that prints greeting message.

Add SirDuke.sayBye() method, that is called when program exits.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create SirDuke.start() method, add Echo functionality, fix style, remove logo
commitResults.messageBody:
-SirDuke.start() method created to contain welcome message printing and user input reading from console

-SirDuke.start() method also contains Echo functionality, and calls SirDuke.sayBye() when "bye" command is received

-horizontalLine variable is a constant, so it's variable name has been changed to HORIZONTAL_LINE
-print messages have been updated to follow style guide for split strings
-logo variable has been removed as it is no longer necessary

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Task.java, ToDoList.java, Format.java SirDuke.java: Move printing of commands to ToDoList class, add switch statement for command execution
commitResults.messageBody:
Each task is as string.

Strings cannot encapsulate whether the task was completed or not.

Let's create a Task class, Task.java to encapsulate the task name and completion status.
Let's create a method to get the name of the Task as a String.

This will help us add other properties of Tasks in future versions (like deadlines)

There is no data structure to store Tasks.

Tasks need to be stored and list needs to be displayed.

Let's create a ToDoList class, ToDoList.java, that contains a HashMap(with variable name toDoList) with task index as the key and the Task as the value.
Let's create a method to add a Task to the list when a String is provided.
Let's create a method to display the index and name of all Tasks in the Hashmap.

This allows us to add other functionalities of the ToDoList in future versions (like deletion of tasks)

SirDuke class prints all commands received.

SirDuke class receives, executes and implements the execution of each command, and this complicates
the function of the SirDuke class.

Let's create a switch statement to call the appropriate method based on the given command.
Let's remove unnceccessary print statements.

We create a switch statement to make it easy to add code for other commands to be handled by the SirDuke class in future versions.
We move implementation of execution of commands to the ToDoList class so that SirDuke class only has to receive command
and decide the corresponding action to take, this categorises the functions of each class and makes it easier to know where to
write code when writing features in future versions.

HORIZONTAL_LINE is common across multiple classes.

We have to create a HORIZONTAL_LINE every time we intend to use it in a class.

Let's create a Format class, Format.java that contains all objects we intend to use for formatting printed output.

This allows us to add other formatting objects and use them across all classes that need them without having to re-define them
every time we need to use them.

add javadoc for for Task class
taskName member changed to string description
status member changed to boolean isDone
both members made protected
getTaskName() method edited accordingly

commitResults.messageTitle: add javadoc for Task.java, edit string representation of Task.java class using toString, change toDoList.java to be compatible with string representation of Task.java
add mark, unmark features to SirDuke.java and complete implementations of mark and unmark in Task.java and ToDoList.java, add error handling for invalid mark and unmark commands
add ToDoTask.java, add DeadlineTask.java, add EventTask.java, move all of them and Task.java into backend.Task package, import backend.Task package to ToDoList.java

add command parsing for todo, deadline and event to SirDuke.java, add implementation of adding todo, deadline and event to list to ToDoList, add user guide for chatbot to SirDuke.java, some style fixes to EventTask.java  and ToDoList.java
add error handling for incomplete add task commands, add error handling for invalid commands
add style fixes for ToDoTask.java, DeadlineTask.java, EventTask.java, SirDuke.java, add removeTask() method in ToDoList.java, make Task.java an abstract class

replace toDoList which is a HashMap data structure, into an ArrayList data structure, standardise indexing to start from 0 in ToDoList.java toDoList, add remove function in SirDuke.java and error handling for invalid inputs
commitResults.messageBody:
ToDoList.java:
- The previous commit had already replaced the HashMap with an ArrayList, we now ensure that the user can refer to a task by it's index starting from 1, and the SirDuke.java class will translate it to the index to start from 0, so that the ToDoList class can operate on the indexes of items as starting from 0
- ArrayList instead of HashMap is preferred, so that when a Task is removed from the ToDoList, the Tasks below it will automatically move up an index in the underlying ArrayList data structure and hence in the ToDoList, this moving up of indexes would be alot harder to implement if we continue to use a HashMap

commitResults.messageTitle: rename removeTask() method in ToDoList.java to deleteTask(), rename "remove" command as "delete"
